text: 6. Now, consider the more general problem of making change when there are k + 1 different coins available, with one being a penny, and the remaining k coins having values v, v, ..., vk, all of which are greater than 1. Let C’(n) be the minimum number of coins needed in this case. For sufficiently large n, how can you express C’(n) in terms of C’() evaluated on amounts smaller than n?
